meanings.definition: The proportion of the incident light or radiation that is reflected by a surface, typically that of a planet or moon.
meanings.sent1: The albedo of the moon makes it shine brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the albedo of planets to understand their reflective properties.
meanings.sent3: The alien mistook the albedo of the lake for a giant mirror and tried to talk to it.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the albedo of fresh snow, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The albedo of the glacier was so high that sunglasses were necessary to look at it.

meanings.definition: The reflecting power of a surface, expressed as the ratio of reflected light to incident light.
meanings.sent1: The albedo of the mirror was so high that it reflected everything clearly.
meanings.sent2: The albedo of the lake made the water appear brighter under the sun.
meanings.sent3: The magician's cloak had an albedo so strong that it seemed to disappear under the stage lights.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had an albedo that brightened up the whole room.
meanings.sent5: The albedo of the polished silver was so intense that it almost blinded me.
